title: Connecticut Probate Records Research - Marie Kashuba Estate Documentation (1999)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Connecticut Probate Records Research - Marie Kashuba Estate Documentation (1999)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting historical probate documentation and microfilm records 
for Marie Kashuba, deceased November 20, 1999, Derby, Connecticut, 
maintained in state library genealogical collections. 

Family genealogical 
research.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Texas Public Information Act, I respectfully request access to the following records related to mental health and counseling services for the current fiscal year (FY 2025–2026) and the past (2024-2025):
1. Counselor-to-student ratios:

Current counselor-to-student ratios for each grade level (elementary, middle, and high school), disaggregated by campus if possible.

2. Mental health staffing data:

The total number of full-time and part-time employees working in:

Counseling Services

Mental Health Services

School-based social work or wellness roles

3. Salary information:

The current salary schedule for counselors and mental health professionals.

Average and median salaries for each of the above roles, or the pay grade ranges assigned to each position title.

4. Staffing trends

If available, a comparison of these figures with the previous fiscal year (FY 2024–2025).

Please provide the information in digital format (PDF or spreadsheet is preferred). If any portion of this request is unclear or would require significant cost, I am happy to clarify or narrow it.

Thank you for your time and attention. I look forward to your response within the time frame required by law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabriela Villegas

title: San Diego Mayor withdrawal from San Diego Pride

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: San Diego Mayor withdrawal from San Diego Pride
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the letter sent by Mayor Todd Gloria on or about June 4, 2025, to San Diego Pride concerning Kehlani. 

2. A copy of each of the "overwhelming number of calls and e-mails" concerning Kehlani, as referenced in the June 4 letter.

3. Any communications between the City of San Deigo (including Mayor Gloria or the Office of the Mayor) and San Diego Pride concerning harassment or any code of conduct relating to performances or performers at San Diego Pride.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sly Stone
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

I request all records related to funk musician Sly Stone. He was born on 15 March 1943 in Denton, TX and died on 9 June 2025.

OTHER NAMES USED

The subject was born Sylvester Stewart.

PROOF OF DEATH

I have attached the subject's news obituary from NPR.

SCOPE OF SEARCH

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction.

FEES

I have no commercial interest in this request, and all records produced in response to this request will be made available immediately to the general public online, for free, via muckrock.com. Please notify me before processing this request if you expect fees to exceed $25.

RECORDS REQUESTED I request all records related to funk musician Sly Stone. He
was born on 15 March 1943 in Denton, TX and died on 9 June 2025. OTHER NAMES

of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic

relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters.
Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and
the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If
any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA,

Sly_Stone_has_died_at_the_age_of_82__NPR.pdf

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.
